  • SEARCH: 
 

Uses of Package
javax0.wtf

  • Packages that use javax0.wtf 
    Package Description
    com.verhas.workflow  
    javax0.wtf
    This package contains the interfaces that define workflow.
    javax0.wtf.functions  
    javax0.wtf.simple
    This package contains the simple workflow implementation.
  • Classes in javax0.wtf used by com.verhas.workflow 
    Class Description
    Action  
    Condition
    This interface has to be implemented by conditions.
    Function
    The methods that are common for actions, conditions, pre functions and post functions.
    PostFunction
    Classes implementing post function should implement this interface.
    PreFunction
    Classes implementing pre-functions should implement this interface.
    Result  
    Validator
    Classes implementing a validator have to implement this interface.
  • Classes in javax0.wtf used by javax0.wtf 
    Class Description
    Action  
    ActionDefinition
    This interface represents an action definition.
    ConditionDefinition  
    Definition
    The common parent of all definition type interfaces like WorkflowDefinition,ActionDefinition etc
    Function
    The methods that are common for actions, conditions, pre functions and post functions.
    FunctionDefinition  
    HasDefinition
    All classes that have a definition counter part should implement this interface.
    NamedEntity
    Action, Result and Step interfaces extend this interface because they define entities that have names.
    PostFunctionDefinition  
    PreFunctionDefinition  
    Result  
    ResultDefinition
    ResultDefinition object is returned by the method PostFunction#postFunction().
    Step  
    StepDefinition
    A workflow StepDefinition defines the state of a workflow (more or less).
    ValidatorDefinition  
    Workflow
    This interface defines the methods that are available to manage the workflow of an item.
    WorkflowDefinition
    This interface has to be implemented by classes that serve as workflow definitions.
    WorkflowEngine
    Each work flow definition may belong to a single engine and the engine may support the work flow definition and as such the work flows executing the definition with services.
